results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Bribery and Kickbacks;Ethics and Official Misconduct;Menendez, Robert;Senate;New Jersey
results.byline: By Tracey Tully, Benjamin Weiser and William K. Rashbaum
results.title: Senator Robert Menendez Faces a New Federal Investigation
results.abstract: The inquiry comes five years after the Justice Department dropped its corruption case against Mr. Menendez, a New Jersey Democrat.

media.caption: In 2015, Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey was indicted on bribery charges. The case ended in a mistrial.

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Insulin;Nursing and Nurses;Deaths (Fatalities);Hospitals;Wake Forest Baptist Medical Center;North Carolina;Winston-Salem (NC)
results.title: Nurse Charged With Murder of Two Patients by Lethal Insulin Doses
results.abstract: The North Carolina nurse, Johnathan Hayes, was also charged with attempted murder over the injection of a third woman who survived, the Forsyth County district attorney said.

media.caption: Johnathan Hayes was a nurse at Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist in Winston-Salem, N.C.

results.adx_keywords: Uterine Cancer;Women and Girls;Research;Shampoos and Hair Products;Black People;Estrogen;Menopause;Tamoxifen (Drug);Content Type: Service
results.title: Uterine Cancer Cases Are Rising. Here’s What to Know.
results.abstract: A new study raised alarms about chemical hair straighteners being linked to the disease, but doctors say there are telltale symptoms to watch for.

results.adx_keywords: Debates (Political);Elections, Governors;Abortion;Crime and Criminals;Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Government Contracts and Procurement;Hochul, Kathleen C;Zeldin, Lee M;Democratic Party;Republican Party;New York State
results.byline: By Luis Ferré-Sadurní and Michael Gold
results.title: Battle for New York: 5 Takeaways From the Hochul-Zeldin Debate
results.abstract: Representative Lee Zeldin conveyed a sense of outrage over crime and the economy, as Gov. Kathy Hochul emphasized his views on abortion and his ties to Donald Trump.

results.adx_keywords: Fashion and Apparel;Rap and Hip-Hop;Anti-Semitism;Advertising and Marketing;West, Kanye;adidas AG
results.byline: By Melissa Eddy, Vanessa Friedman and Michael J. de la Merced
results.title: Adidas Ends Partnership With Kanye West at a Considerable Cost
results.abstract: The German sportswear giant is the latest company to cut ties with Mr. West, now known as Ye, after his antisemitic remarks. Ending the partnership is expected to hurt company profits.

media.caption: Kanye West, now known as Ye, in Hollywood in 2016 at an event promoting his partnership with Adidas.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Decisions and Verdicts;Presidential Election of 2020;Voter Fraud (Election Fraud);Courts and the Judiciary;Meadows, Mark R (1959- );McBurney, Robert C I;Trump, Donald J;Willis, Fani T;Georgia
results.byline: By Richard Fausset and Danny Hakim
results.title: Meadows Ordered to Testify in Georgia Election Investigation
results.abstract: Mark Meadows, a former White House chief of staff, has been fighting to avoid testifying about efforts to keep former President Donald J. Trump in power after he lost the 2020 election.

media.caption: Mark Meadows has been fighting to avoid appearing before a special grand jury that has been investigating election interference in Georgia by Mr. Trump and his allies.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Elections, Senate;Debates (Political);Fetterman, John (1969- );Oz, Mehmet C;Democratic Party;Republican Party;Pennsylvania
results.title: Fetterman, Showing Stroke Effects, Battles Oz in Hostile Senate Debate
results.abstract: Lt. Gov. John Fetterman, a Democrat, tried to assure voters of his fitness to serve. Dr. Mehmet Oz, a former celebrity physician and Republican, attacked him as too radical for the job.

media.caption: Mr. Fetterman’s words were frequently halting, but he was also fluent at other times when it came to presenting his Democratic vision.

results.adx_keywords: Television;Comedy and Humor;Content Type: Personal Profile;Corden, James (1978- );McNally, Keith;Balthazar (Manhattan, NY, Restaurant)
results.title: James Corden and the Dangers of Likability
results.abstract: No one knows what an egg yolk omelet is, but we all know that TV hosts should be relatable. Or should they? That didn’t do Ellen DeGeneres any favors.

media.caption: James Corden at a Tony Awards party in 2019. He presents himself as an ordinary bloke but is actually a Broadway star well known in Britain before arriving in the United States.
media.copyright: Rebecca Smeyne for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Elections, Senate;Debates (Political);Fetterman, John (1969- );Oz, Mehmet C;Democratic Party;Republican Party;Senate;Pennsylvania
results.byline: By Katie Glueck and Trip Gabriel
results.title: 5 Takeaways From the Pennsylvania Senate Debate
results.abstract: Lt. Gov. John Fetterman and Mehmet Oz traded blows over abortion, fracking and empathy for working people in the first and final debate of their closely watched Senate race.

results.adx_keywords: Education (K-12);Admissions Standards;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Segregation and Desegregation;Banks, David C (1962- );Hochul, Kathleen C;Anderson School PS 334 (Manhattan, NY);New York City
results.title: More Than 100 N.Y.C. Middle Schools Will Drop Selective Screens
results.abstract: Local districts decided whether to allow middle schools to use grades in choosing students. The majority chose to keep a less competitive lottery system that began during the pandemic.

media.caption: Intermediate School 238 in Hollis, Queens, is in one of just two districts that will increase the number of middle schools using screened admissions.
media.copyright: Jeenah Moon for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Cooking and Cookbooks;Risotto;Food;Recipes;Garten, Ina;Roseberry, Daniel;Schiaparelli, Elsa, SAS
results.title: Ina Garten Makes Risotto With a Longtime Fan
results.abstract: The designer Daniel Roseberry learned everything he knows about preparing a meal from the beloved cookbook author. For a new T series, the two finally met.

results.title: Some Breast Cancer Patients Could Skip Surgery, Study Suggests
results.abstract: In a small trial, chemotherapy alone was sufficient to treat women with certain kinds of tumors.

media.caption: Chemotherapy being administered to a breast cancer patient in October.

results.adx_keywords: Recalls and Bans of Products;Cleansers, Detergents and Soaps;Bacteria;Infections;Consumer Protection;Clorox Company;Consumer Product Safety Commission
results.title: What to Know About the Pine-Sol Recall
results.abstract: Clorox is voluntarily recalling tens of millions of bottles of scented Pine-Sol cleaning products that may be contaminated with bacteria.

media.caption: The recalled products include Pine-Sol Scented Multi-Surface Cleaners, in Lavender Clean, Sparkling Wave and Lemon Fresh scents.

results.adx_keywords: Web-Original Programming;Comedy and Humor;Generation Z;Fulmer, Ned;YouTube.com
results.title: The Try Guys and the Prison of Online Fame
results.abstract: This is what success looks like in the creator economy: Sometimes you have to beg millions of fans for mercy.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Debates (Political);Polls and Public Opinion;Fetterman, John (1969- );Oz, Mehmet C;Democratic Party;Republican Party;Pennsylvania
results.byline: By Katie Glueck and Alyce McFadden
results.title: Pennsylvania Voters Absorb an Unusual Debate: ‘I Felt Sorry for Fetterman’
results.abstract: In interviews, Democrats and Republicans had a range of reactions to the state’s Senate debate, including alarm, protectiveness, empathy and worry about the political implications.

media.caption: “I felt sorry for Fetterman,” said Deb Donahue, 68, a registered Republican and a Mehmet Oz supporter from Camp Hill, Pa. “I think he really struggled a little bit.”
media.copyright: Amanda Mustard for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Firearms;Gun Control;Law and Legislation;Gun Owners of America;Public Safety Department (Tex);Texas
results.title: Texas Goes Permitless on Guns, and Police Face an Armed Public
results.abstract: A new law allowing people to carry handguns without a license has led to more spontaneous shootings, many in law enforcement say.

media.caption: Texas is the most populous state to do away with handgun permit requirements.
media.copyright: Matthew Busch for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Race and Ethnicity;Discrimination;Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods;City Councils;Herrera, Ron (Union Leader);Martinez, Nury;Los Angeles (Calif)
results.title: L.A.P.D. Opens Criminal Inquiry Into Recording That Captured Racist Remarks
results.abstract: The police chief said that all four people who took part in the secretly recorded conversation, two of whom are still City Council members, had requested an investigation into whether it was made illegally.
des_facet: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods

media.caption: Nury Martinez, the former Los Angeles City Council president, in April. The Police Department is investigating whether a recording that captured her and other council members making offensive remarks was made illegally.

results.adx_keywords: Suits and Litigation (Civil);Priests;Sex Crimes;Child Abuse and Neglect;Politics and Government;James, Letitia;Malone, Richard J;Grosz, Edward M;Roman Catholic Church;Buffalo (NY);New York State
results.title: Catholic Diocese of Buffalo Will Submit to Government Oversight
results.abstract: The church reached a settlement with the New York attorney general after a lawsuit accusing officials of a yearslong cover-up of sexual abuse.

media.caption: Former Bishop Richard Malone of Buffalo will be banned for life from holding any fiduciary role in a charity registered in New York.

results.adx_keywords: Fossils;Paleontology;New Zealand;South Island (New Zealand)
results.title: In New Zealand, a 23-Million-Year-Old Fossil Is Carried Away by Parties Unknown
results.abstract: The whale fossil, a cherished local attraction, was taken from a riverbank in broad daylight by two men with a rock saw and chisel, residents say.

media.caption: The town of Westport, on New Zealand’s remote West Coast, about 60 miles from where the fossil was taken.

results.title: The Trump Subpoena
results.abstract: The Jan. 6 committee has voted to subpoena former President Donald J. Trump. It’s a momentous move, but it’s not without precedent.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack
